title: Adding Recipes to IC2
description: I see some, if not all, of the recipes for the machines are changed from vanilla IC2, shall we add them here?

replies.body:
There aren't very many IC2 machine recipes actually changed; most are just overwritten with new machines.
And this is filed under the rather extensive "Changed Recipes" section.

Well, most machines seem to require plates and different hulls. Compare for example:

Canning machine in IC2:

Circuit
Machine Block
7 Tin Ingots

to GT Recipe:

Circuit
7 Tin Plates
Steel/Stainless Steel Machine Hull

This is just an example, but the actual recipe for said Canning Machine is not anywhere in this wiki.

Nothing involving Stainless Steel is properly documented yet.  However, unless I am mistaken, IC2 is going over to the standard of using Plates for a whole bunch of stuff, so that may be a non-issue soon.

Even if IC2 goes to plates (good piece of info there!) the machine blocks will still change.

The thing is, if SS is not well documented, shall we start documenting it?

What do you suggest then, wait for, say, 10 days and then document?

I've just started here, so don't want to step on the toes of anyone.

Thanks for the heads up.

hanks for the heads up.

If you want to start working on Stainless Steel, go for it.
The Machine Block recipe change is documented (see Changed Recipes)
